name: Animal Taxonomy and Inheritance
description: Tests basic taxonomic reasoning with IS_A relationships and transitive inference

theory.natural_language: In the animal kingdom, we have a clear hierarchy. Dogs are mammals. Cats are also mammals. All mammals are animals. All animals are living things. Fido is a specific dog that belongs to my neighbor. Whiskers is a cat that lives in our house. Birds are animals too, but they are not mammals. Sparky is a bird.

expected_answer.explanation: Fido is a dog, dogs are mammals, mammals are animals, therefore Fido is an animal (transitive IS_A chain)

expected_answer.natural_language: Yes, Whiskers is a living thing.
expected_answer.explanation: Whiskers is a cat, cats are mammals, mammals are animals, animals are living things

expected_answer.natural_language: No, Sparky is not a mammal. Sparky is a bird, and birds are animals but not mammals.
expected_answer.explanation: Sparky is a bird, birds are animals but there is no path from bird to mammal
